title: How to Make Watermelon Pops

steps.headline: Cut the watermelon into small pieces and remove all the seeds.
Put the pieces into the blender.
Add the salt, sugar, mint leaves, and lemon juice to the pieces.
steps.description:
Run the blender until you have a pulpy mixture. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e4\/Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/e\/e4\/Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/aid3779935-v4-728px-Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into a mould or paper cup.
Add pieces of chocolates to the mix.
steps.description:
Alternately, you could add bits of your favourite fruit{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/77\/Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/77\/Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid3779935-v4-728px-Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

steps.headline: Make a small cut on the middle of cup lids.
Cover the cup with the lids and place an ice cream stick upright, in the centre of the cup.
Place the cup in the freezer for a couple of hours.
Once the mixture has set, pour a little water into the cup.
Pull the Popsicle stick out of the mold.

text:
Cut the watermelon into small pieces and remove all the seeds. Put the pieces into the blender. Add the salt, sugar, mint leaves, and lemon juice to the pieces. Run the blender until you have a pulpy mixture. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e4\/Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/e\/e4\/Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/aid3779935-v4-728px-Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Pour the mixture into a mould or paper cup. Add pieces of chocolates to the mix. Alternately, you could add bits of your favourite fruit{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/77\/Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/77\/Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid3779935-v4-728px-Make-Watermelon-Pops-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Make a small cut on the middle of cup lids. Cover the cup with the lids and place an ice cream stick upright, in the centre of the cup. Place the cup in the freezer for a couple of hours. Once the mixture has set, pour a little water into the cup. Pull the Popsicle stick out of the mold. Finished.
